reference.title: Retrieving auto-failover settings
reference.shortdesc: Auto-failover setting are retrieved with the GET /settins/autoFailover HTTP method and URI.

section.title: HTTP method and URI
section.p: Use this request to retrieve any auto-failover settings for a cluster. Auto-failover is a global setting for all clusters. Authenticated is required to read this value.

ul.li: enabled: Value is true or false. True if auto-failover is enabled; False if it is not.
timeout: Seconds that must elapse before auto-failover executes on a cluster.

count: Value is 0 or 1. Number of times any node in a cluster can be automatically failed-over. After one auto-failover occurs, the count is set to 1 and Couchbase server does not perform auto-failover for the cluster again unless the count is reset to 0. To failover more than one node at a time in a cluster, perform a manual failover.

section.title: Response
section.p: If successful Couchbase Server returns any auto-failover settings for the cluster:

section.title: Response codes
section.codeblock: HTTP/1.1 401 Unauthorized This endpoint isn't available yet.
GET /settings/autoFailover HTTP/1.1 Host: localhost:8091 Authorization: Basic YWRtaW46YWRtaW4= Accept: */*
HTTP/1.1 200 OK Content-Type: application/json Content-Length: nnn { "enabled": false, "timeout": 30, "count": 0 }
